semantic_title: Genetic Carrier Status (Z14) - Definition and Clinical Significance
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 21. Factors Influencing Health Status > c. Categories of Z Codes > 3) Status

content.full_text: Genetic carrier status indicates that a person carries a gene, associated with a particular disease, which may be passed to offspring who may develop that disease. The person does not have the disease and is not at risk of developing the disease. (Evidence: pg no: 94, L24)
content.summary: Z14 codes indicate genetic carrier status where person carries disease gene but doesn't have disease and isn't at risk (Evidence: pg no: 94, L24)
key_concepts: Genetic carrier status (Evidence: pg no: 94, L24)
Gene transmission to offspring (Evidence: pg no: 94, L24)
No current disease (Evidence: pg no: 94, L24)
No personal risk (Evidence: pg no: 94, L24)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Person carries gene but does not have disease and is not at risk (Evidence: pg no: 94, L24)
detailed_rules.explanation: Genetic carrier status means carrying a disease-associated gene that can be passed to offspring without personal disease risk (Evidence: pg no: 94, L24)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Confirm genetic testing shows carrier status
Step 2: Verify patient has no current disease
